description: From Latin dēcorticātus, past participle of dēcorticāre.

examples: visually decorticatehaving had the visual cortex removed

verbs.description: decorticate (third-person singular simple present decorticates, present participle decorticating, simple past and past participle decorticated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To peel or remove the bark, husk, or outer layer from something.
(transitive) To surgically remove the surface layer, membrane, or fibrous cover of an organ etc.
